title: Transparency
body:
does anyone think there should be constant annoying warnings for behavior?
after my 10 day restriction i never got another window warning again, just straight to the 25 game restriction to the 14 day ban

if a window popped up every time i got reported maybe i would've changed lol
but nah they just wait and jumpscare you with the punishments
really wish instead of going to honor 5 and DROPPING to honor 0 you could get promoted or demoted similarly to the league rankings
idk this lack of transparency is kinda limiting in my opinion

edit: i'm just saying instead of playing a game and sitting wondering "wow i wonder how close i am to being banned"
instead it gives a window saying "you are close to being restricted" or some window like that, u know?

replies.body: The issue with this is it didn't encourage reform - it encourages players to be just as toxic as they want until they get that message, then act okay for a short time, then repeat.

Currently the system is that your warnings are the punishments and I find this more than agreeable, but I would not mind some kind of warning before that.

No progress bar type thing though. There is no level of acceptable toxicity and a mention of progress would indicate otherwise.

There used to be a warning popup but it was removed because it only indicated that you were reported and not that you were actually behaving poorly, with the automated system that could be fixed.
I thought the old one was removed because when it popped, people that they had been punished. So support was getting flooded with messages of "Why ban?"

Nah, I remember a red saying that it was removed because it contained no real information concerning how punishable your actions actually were, but that was quite a while ago and I don't save links to red quotes like I should.

a little nudge could be good for people.

"Hey we notice you seem to be less than positive lately, perhaps you should take a short break?"

> [{quoted}](name=LuciferDraco,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=H99bZLYd,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-05-26T06:23:06.254+0000)
>
> a little nudge could be good for people.
> 
> "Hey we notice you seem to be less than positive lately, perhaps you should take a short break?"

yeah you got what i mean
i just think it would help if people got small warnings before they were hit with the huge 14 day/forever ban
Why do you need constant reminders to be respectful?

>after my 10 day restriction i never got another window warning again, just straight to the 25 game restriction to the 14 day ban

>edit: i'm just saying instead of playing a game and sitting wondering "wow i wonder how close i am to being banned"

I'll be a popup window for you. _You are very close to being permanently banned_. If you didn't get the hint after 35 games of chat restrictions AND a 14-day suspension, what more can zero-consequence popups provide? Why would you change for a simple message when actual, tangible consequences explicitly telling you that you have made mistakes have been provided?
